caption: Nice food and friendly environment 👍👍👍👍 awesome
I went here when it first opened. It was packed with a long wait time but it was well worth it. The food was hot and delicious. Very friendly servers. Great experience. Looking forward to going back.
The Chicken Tika Masala is the best in the area. I cannot get enough of it!

Literally the best restaurant I’ve ever been to (and I’ve been to MANY).  How is this place not featured on television programs, I have not a clue.  We ordered the Tandoori dinner and Vegetarian dinner and walked out of the restaurant STUFFED. One completed dinner can easily be split between two adults.  I’m still in absolute awe of how good this place was today.. Wow
My first experience was an amazing! Food that was recommended was so good. We will be back for more.
First time trying Indian food and the food was amazing🥰

Wonderful experience! We could tell it was going to be good when we walked in and the smell from the kitchen infiltrated our noses with love. Their vegetable corma was HEAVENLY!! It was the best corma I have had EVER.  Their mango lasse was delicious!! And their naan 10/10.  The staff was so warm, friendly, and welcoming it was a wonderful experience overall😊
Ordered via Uber eats tonight. Excellent Vindaloo and Biryani. Can’t wait to try them again in person.
Thank You ,Thank You : This restaurant was all about service in every way. Communicate,   Positive Attitude,  and most of all the food was Great. !!! THANK YOU

After a wonderful experience in Pigeon Forge, we are now sitting in Mantra Indian restaurant in New Orleans. Meal has been ordered and waiting for food. So far everything is going "less than stellar". The guy playing the role of host is "cold".  Request to switch some selection in prefix dinner has been frowned upon despite explanation of the dairy allergy situation.  Another gentleman pacing the restaurant, seems senior, is also in need of training on how to be welcoming.  I just hope the food is worth this cold treatment. Otherwise the premium pricing of their menu is a total waste.
Great Food....Perfect for spice lovers...

The best Indian food in Louisiana! And we've tried a lot. It is true  Indian food and  not a fusion. The service was fast, friendly and efficient. This was a great experience with great food and we can't wait to go back.
Food is great and staff is friendly!
Great food. Spicy vindaloo and lots of it.
The food here is amazing. Every dish was better than the next!!

Tricky to get to, worth the effort!  Charming, engaging owner, extensive menu done authentically. Rogan Josh is my "first order" at an Indian restaurant and this was superlative. I am not a fan of Spinach dishes, but I am now! My girlfriend's Chicken Saag was fantastic. The seasoning of both was complex and satisfying, indicating quality ingredients. Vegetarians note: HUGE selection.  The pickled sides and chutneys were clearly house-made. We will be working our way through this menu, you should as well!
Decent place for Indian food in New Orleans.
Absolutely spectacular!!
Best Indian food in the city. The atmosphere is very nice and clean and the staff was so friendly. Highly recommend! Won't go anywhere else.
Really good! Service was great!
I ate naan, chicken Tikka masala and samosa it was amazing .
Terrific food.  Personal service.  Take spicy seriously.  Highly recommend.

Everything was delicious! Far and away the best Indian food in the New Orleans area at a good price. I ordered the samosas, Rogan Josh, Malai Kofta, Karahi Vegetable Curry, and Naan - all spectacular.

This meal was INCREDIBLE. We have been watching the reviews and wanted to try it, and I am so glad we did. This is hands down the best Indian food in the NOLA area. Good is an insult to this place- it’s so much better. It belongs on Guy’s Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives. The staff was helpful and attentive. I will be back... maybe even tomorrow!

I noticed this place during the week and tried it today for the first time. The restaurant itself is very clean and quiet. The staff is professional, attentive, and masked. You are given the option to order your entree mild, medium, or spicy. The Fried Onion appetizer is delicious. The Chicken Saag is creamy and savory. And, the Chicken  Vindaloo is delectable fire! I look forward to going back again and again to try ALL OF IT! I hope Mantra is around for a LOOOOOOOONG time!
Authentic Indian food.
Really good Rogan Josh

My husband and I had dinner last night. We had samosa and onion bhaji for appetizer. My husband had non-vegetarian dinner and I had karahi vegetables and chicken vindaloo (spicy).  All dishes are so delicious. Chicken Vindaloo is fantastic. Service is great and friendly. We are definitely going back. Thanks for the great food, Mantra.
First time eating Indian food. It was pretty good. Yes, I plan on going back!

Quite possibly the best Indian food in Lousiana!   Every dish we've ordered the 2 times we've been has been DELICIOUS!   THE menu is a la carte and NOT a buffet, but we always leave with leftovers. Decent sized restaurant  and the service is great!  Sometimes you will need to be patient for your food,  as they tend to be busy with both dine in and take out.  This is our new and probably only Indian wel'll go to now in GNO.
Food was great! Restaurant was clean! And all the staff were wearing masks! I will definitely be going back!
Good work

Finally, an authentic Indian restaurant in the New Orleans area. Mantra opened last month and I stopped by over the weekend for lunch. Location was right off I-10 so couldn’t be more convenient. Seating for 50 people but due to COVID-19 restrictions, only 20 odd people were allowed at one time so almost an hour wait. Decor was ok but the great service almost made us feel like fine dining. We ordered samosa chat (6.95) and chili chicken (11.95) for appetizers. Samosa chat was good but chili chicken was mediocre. We also ordered mango lassi (3.95) and it was good. We ordered chicken tikka masala (13.95) from chicken entrees and paneer masala (12.95) from vegetarian entrees and they were both equally good. The food came with white rice. We also ordered the bread sampler basket (6.95) which came with a mix of 3 Naans, highly recommended. I requested some raw onions but for some strange reason, it took forever to arrive so that’s the only thing I’ll take against their service. We also ordered gulab jamun (2.95) and Ras malai (3.95) for desserts and they were good. Overall, 4 out of 5 and next time, I’ll do takeout and try their other dishes. Btw, the most authentic Indian restaurant in Louisiana before ‘Mantra’ was in Hammond, Punjabi Dhaba so I was pleasantly surprised to see the same chef and another employee on the front desk from there. The food tasted exactly like ‘Punjabi Dhaba’ so I wouldn’t be surprised if one of the chefs from there has opened this establishment. I would advice Indian food lovers to avoid the worse Indian restaurant on Magazine street, Saffron Nola, supposedly a fusion restaurant. These people know nothing about Indian food or local Louisiana food for that matter. Anyone who dines here knows nothing about Indian food. Anyway, after living in New York all my life and eating authentic/ good Indian food, it was nice to eat it again in New Orleans at Mantra or if you’re in Hammond, at Punjabi Dhaba but pls do avoid, the fake wannabe high priced dump like ‘Saffron Nola’ at all cost.  December 31, 2020 It was my 3rd trip to Mantra and let’s just say that I’ve found the most authentic Indian restaurant in Louisiana period. Everything from chole bature to chicken tikka masala to paneer masala to lamb vindaloo to shrimp curry to chicken mantra was good. Dessert does need some work as kheer and ras malai was pretty mediocre. Service was excellent as always. Ignorance is bless if you’re still eating at the dump ‘saffron nola’ on magazine street!
Best Indian food in the city
Amazing service and the food is delicious.

Placed a lunch pickup order on 12/29/20, first time eating here.  Food was absolutely fantastic.  I've been to several other Indian restaurants in the New Orleans area, this one is the new runaway favorite.  The staff was polite and friendly, order was ready faster than originally stated, and they even call you back when your food is ready for pickup.  My go-to entree for Indian is Karahi chicken, and Mantra's is the best I've ever had.  Medium spicy is just enough heat to make your mouth tingle, chicken is tender, bell peppers are cooked perfectly (still a little bite, not soft and soggy).  Garlic naan was perfectly charred, veggie pakora was crispy and delicious.  Keep it up!
Really enjoyed the food! The only complaint I have was with Aloo Gobi. It was. like boiled gobi and lack any spices. But everything else was really great.
Excellent food. Excellent service.
Really good Indian food! You wouldn't be disappointed. And Kaushik the waiter is so much fun to talk to. If you need recommendation on what phone to buy, just ask him 😄
First time.  Saag was great,  Naan excellent. Tandoori was overcooked but tasty. Will go back.

The food and service were impeccable, it was my first time and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. I had the chicken curry, my taste buds were very happy. Definitely the best Indian restaurant in New Orleans!

My new favorite takeout spot. I love that they have so many vegetarian options. Huge fan of the samosas. I had the Chana Saag my first visit and the Chana Masala last night. My husband had the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Fish Korma...all of it excellent. Takeout has been great, the price is right, and we always have leftovers! Efficient operations and they always call when your takeout order is ready. Very pleased so far and we look forward to trying more of the menu!

Food was good & staff was very friendly. The only bad thing was me not knowing what to order. The server was kind and patient helping out a rookie ordering. Got a meal that was a variety so could sample a few different things.
Food is very good..large menu..no separate lunch menu, so you need to understand that lunch for 2 with 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and no liquor or dessert will run you at least 60.00.
Really nice atmosphere with relatively inexpensive super flavorful and delicious North Indian food. Naan to die for!

I ordered chicken starter and biryani. Order taking experience is good and also they will call once order is ready which I liked. Chicken starter was really good- chicken 65 with very good flavour and tandoori chicken- well cooked and I found exact taste of tandoori. But chicken biryani was tastes like chicken pulav and I found capsicum, cashew, onion and tomato. Also I ordered spicy level and I got sweet taste. Overall I liked the food and other experience except chicken biryani.
Delicious indian food and very good service!
The Chicken Tikka  Masala, Murg Makini, Carrot halwa, Paneer and "GARLIC NAAN",is to die for...I'm addicted ...please help!!!
Achari Chicken curry and Chicken 65 taste was too good. But Goat Biriyani was too bad, I felt it’s like veg pulav.  I suggest you to please spend some time in you tube for Goat Biriyani.
Delicious chicken biryani
Food was wonderful! Can't wait to go back. The staff was friendly and made the experience perfect.
I’ve only had it once but it defeats the other Indian options I’ve had in the area. I’ll order from them many times in the future I’m sure.  Looking forward to many great meals.

Wow! I've been eating Indian food since I was a child, and now that I on my 50s, I've finally found Indian food Nirvana at Mantra. I was happy to drive to Punjabi Dhaba in Hammond for great tikka masala and naan, but I'm now thrilled to have the same high quality food in a lovely sit down atmosphere with great service. So far, I've tried the aloo paratha, keema naan, garlic naan, and chili naan and all of them were flavorful, light, and fluffy. The tandoori paneer was like nothing I've had before, roasted with bell peppers, charred, hearty and delicious. We also had the chole with fry bread, which was a delightful surprise, cooked perfectly and so savory. The kofta korma was fresh, firm, and delectable, topped with cheese. Creamy, fragrant, I could dive into that sauce! For spice lovers, the vindaloo and Goran curry were smoky and complex. Mantra is fantastic. I'll be visiting again and again. You should, too!
Really great food. Well prepared. Best indian food in NOLA. Service, unlike other comments, was exceptional. Only recommendation is to lower the lights and play some music. We will be regulars.
Came for a quick lunch since I work in Metairie, ordered the chicken vindaloo, spicy. It was the best I've had in New Orleans. I'm coming back for dinner with my wife so we can try more dishes.

Great service and great menu selection!! Hostess and servers were too kind and gracious. Food was out and on the table, nicely served and pretty quickly. I got the coconut chicken, medium spice and it did not disappoint. Creamy and delicious. Guy!!!!Totally recommend.
The place offers a great range of delicious food. I enjoyed eating her staff members are always super nice, I enjoyed the fantastic characters and yummy dishes and beverages. Fantastic work

My first experience here was so great, I couldn’t wait to go back. Today I came in and had some questions about the menu because I have dietary restrictions. The waiter was extremely rude and condescending, even though I was trying to be nice and understanding. On top of that, he would walk by our table and make snarky comments about how I’m eating my food. Will not be returning, and I don’t recommend going here if you have any dietary restrictions as they will not respect them and will be rude to you about it.
We had a great experience! The Naan was outstanding. The mint dipping sauce was exceptional! Our entrees were equally as good. The Chicken Vindaloo was out of this world!
One of the most arrogant waitresses I’ve spoken to on the phone. Got chicken biryani, it was really just rice. Barely any chicken pieces. Mediocre quality of food.
Went for dine in on a Wednesday afternoon. The service was quick and the food was really great. Hats off to the chef. Great job on food.

We had dinner tonight here for the very first time tonight. They were very busy but accommodating. The service was very friendly and help us make an excellent decision of what to eat.  The tandoori dinner was divine and the best chicken tikka masala we ever had.

Will rate 4 stars as food is good but service is very poor. You cannot wait for hours to be seated specially with the family! Please fix this problem before customers start finding alternative options! Good luck!

Went last night (11/7) about 845p, excited to try out this new place that took over City Diner. Lived here for decades.  Arrived then that hostess told us they were booked for the night & not accepting anymore customers due to other reservations. Ok, so we asked if we can order to go. She told us no.. (what?). So thinking of a solution, I said ok guess I need to call ahead of time and make a reservation. She said no we don't over the phone anymore due to people not showing up and that we have to come in person to know with a "sorry" (Really?Reservation notepad had names and callback #s.. I was not coming in 10 min before close). So you're expecting your customers to guess on a Saturday night, in person, whether y'all are available or not? She just looked at me & said some things with some attitude with another "I'm sorry."  I worked in the restaurant business for years so I have some degree of sympathy for people in that realm, but that was some garbage service by that hostess-unless everything she said was actually true, then absolutely never going back nor should any other bz man or woman (why I'm writing this to save others time & the headache). Food looks great but that was very annoying & disrespectful. Not going back until the owners fix that.
Excellent food, they are just starting - so give them sometime to settle own. Very neat and clean place with friendly staff. Sandy waited on us and she is great. Authentic Indian cuisine.

Incredibly good food, although a bit slow to come out of the kitchen. Worth the wait. Would suggest that they buy some dimmers for the lighting. Way too bright unless you're going for that department store feel.
Very good Indian food, extra friendly staff, and fast service

I don't know how fair 2 stars is, but for now, it's my rating. Mostly because the service was unbearably slow, and the food came out bit by bit. We ordered the onion bhaji as an appetizer. After an exceptionally long wait, whereas I had time to down 2 goblets of water, the onions came out (think fried onion petals, indian style). I got about two bites into one piece, when the chicken biryani and the chicken tikka masala arrived. Hmmmm.  The onion bhaji itself was really good, but the chutneys were sort of non descript and served in disposable plastic cups. I ate more onions while my lunch date started in on the biryani, which I had a bite of it, and it was DELICIOUS. The dish it came on was absolutely beautiful, as well. I mentioned that I was surprised the chicken tikka masala didn't come with rice, as it was a lot of tomato gravy in the very intricate bowl. A few bites later, a gorgeous bowl of rice was delivered, and we also let the person know we had ordered naan. He said he was aware. It was strange that the rice was not delivered with the tikka masala and then stranger still that the naan showed up significantly later. The tikka masala, while flavorful, was very sweet and had no heat to it, which was disappointing. (When we were handed the receipt, I noticed it had been put in as "mild", but I was not asked about spice level preference.) The cheese stuffed naan was REALLY, REALLY good. Really good. We finished our meal, and waited for boxes. And waited. And waited. And waited. And then waited for our check. And waited. And waited. And waited. And waited.  I would be hesitant to eat here again, just because the service was....so so so slow. I would love to try a few more dishes, and I'd definitely like to try the chicken tikka masala with some heat to it. Hopefully, they can work these issues out and someone will convince me to try again. (It was quite obvious that other diners were agitated at the level of service, as well.)
Some of the best Indian food I've had in the city.   Great food at a great price.   Really friendly staff.

This place has the ABSOLUTE worse service!! I wish I could give it no stars it doesn’t deserve ANY!! Then on top of that, the lady to the front, is so inconsiderate and has the worse attitude EVER!! No good customer service AT ALL!! WILL NOT BE RETURNING!!

Ordered food, an hour later still heard nothing. Called the place said the food was being put in bags. 20 minutes later, STILL not out. Someone clearly lying to me about the status of my order. I really -want- to like this place, but this is garbage tier customer service. Do. Better. Might update this to a better rating later if I -ever- get my food.
Food is amazing! Better than the others in the new orleans area. Definitely my new favorite indian place.
The food is fantastic, though the spice levels are legit. Don't be afraid to ask for medium or mild! Try the garlic naan.

Horrible Horrible customer service! First of all,no one picked up the phone for taking my take out order after trying numerous times.Then we decided to place the pickup order through doordash.When I arrived to pick up,they didn't have my order and said they are having some technical issues with doordash and asked me to resolve myself.FYI,they just updated their closing time to 10:00pm. It was 8pm when I was at the location and asked to place the order again. To which they denied and said they can not take anymore order for the day.so,they are Ok with denying customers for 2 hours till they close? Please don't waste your time.
Great service! And even better food! Everything was perfect from the moment we stepped in to the moment we left. Highly recommend
Awesome!!!

Wow! What a great new spot to discover. Everything was absolutely delicious, the flavors were awesome. Hands down beats out the limited competition that has been serving our area for quite some time. The chana saag was fantastic, the spices were perfectly matched to the dish. The staff was super nice, great folks. Really happy to see them doing so well in their opening week, good amount of people coming in and everyone seemed really happy with what they ordered.  Very good naan, certainly didn't come out of a food service box from Deep. The mint chutney on the side was fresh and full of flavor. Parathas were great. Shrimp vindaloo was excellent and the chicken tikka masala was ridiculously good. We accidentally also ordered an aloo gobi entrée but that was a great mistake to enjoy for lunch the next day. Yummy samosas!  Will definitely be back. Congratulations on your new restaurant and I hope it brings you both lots of success in the future!
Got samosas, non-veg dinner, biryani and lamb rogan Josh. It was all delicious. Good portions. Nice people. Coming back regularly
Delicious and fresh Indian food. Highly recommend. Service was excellent. We will be back. Thank you for the heavenly food and experience.
Excellent food, excellent service, very nice staff and very clean restaurant! Thank you for the warm hospitality and wonderful meal. Your restaurant will be a huge success!!!

Just had dinner here tonight, and first off, the food is AMAZING and DELICIOUS!! The staff are soooo accommodating, kind, and very attentive! Even on a very busy night like tonight where they had a almost to covid capacity house and lots of to-go orders! All covid protocols were followed by staff and customers! We ordered the tomato soup, lamb vindaloo (spicy), mantra chicken (spicy), and Naan sampler basket! The entrees also came with rice! Seriously, the food was SO delicious and authentic and we haven’t had Indian food like this in New Orleans for at least 10 years!! Cannot wait to go back there more often or to order via Waitr or Grubhub!!
Service was fast and staff was awesome. Food came out quickly and was good. Had an indian beer selection as well. Only had an appetizer (lamb kabobs which were great) but will definitely be back!
Great food with really good authentic beer options!
Nice delicious menu
Best Indian food I've ever had! We got the Murg Makhni (butter chicken), Mango chicken, and the garlic naan bread. Everything was devoured within minutes it was so good!

Thats the best indian cuisine in new orleans area.all employees treat us like a family, they are so friendly and nice people. Food was soo delicious it remind me india. They take care of you alot once you on there premises. I would highly recommend this place. Lady up front was soo nice to us all the time. Will visit again more often.
Dropped in on Mon I think. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. The place has a cool feel to it.
do yourself a favor and give this place a try. it has a nice interior. menu is like a place in san francisco i loved.
